sections.content: Wireless microphones freed creators from cable constraints. The Rode Wireless GO II and DJI Mic are the two most popular compact wireless systems. Both record internally, work with cameras and phones, and deliver broadcast-quality audio. Here's how to choose.

sections.title: Rode Wireless GO vs DJI Mic Comparison

content.title: Ultra Compact
content.description: Smaller, lighter transmitters. Less visible on camera.

content.title: More Internal Storage
content.description: 40+ hours of backup recording. Peace of mind.

content.title: Proven Track Record

sections.title: Which Should You Choose?
content: Choose Rode if: Ultra-compact size matters
Choose Rode if: You need maximum backup recording
Choose Rode if: Camera use is primary
Choose DJI if: Charging case convenience matters
Choose DJI if: Phone recording is common
Choose DJI if: Touchscreen control appeals to you

faq.question: Which has better audio quality?
faq.answer: Very close. Both are excellent. Rode slightly warmer, DJI slightly crisper. Most viewers won't hear a difference.

faq.question: Do I need internal recording?
faq.answer: Highly recommended. Wireless can fail. Internal backup has saved countless shoots. Both offer this essential feature.

faq.question: Which is better for vlogging?
faq.answer: DJI's phone connectivity and charging case suit mobile vloggers. Rode's compact size is less visible. Both work great.

faq.question: What about the Rode Wireless ME?
faq.answer: Simpler, cheaper, phone-focused. Good for casual use. GO II and DJI Mic are more capable for serious creators.
